conclusion: Introduction to the problem with a glass sphere and light source S.
Light from S reaches the sphere, some reflects upwards, some enters and reflects off the silvered surface.
Sphere is symmetric about its axis, S is on this axis.
Sphere center at O, axis through O and M, M is the top point.
Right side of the sphere is silvered, acts as a mirror.
Focus on the light path entering the sphere, reflecting, and returning.
Ray from S enters at P, travels to Q, reflects back to S.
Ray returns along its original path, angles and refractive indices allow reversibility.
Set up coordinates with O at origin, M at (0,R).
Sphere has radius R, center O, M is on the axis.
Ray path S to P to Q to P to S must be symmetric.
Light source S is like the object, image formed along the axis.
Light reflects off surface upwards, part enters glass and reflects internally.
Focus on light entering glass, reflecting off silvered surface, returning.
